biotools.summary: MAAPER is a computational method for model-based analysis of alternative polyadenylation using 3’ end-linked reads. It uses a probabilistic model to predict polydenylation sites (PASs) for nearSite reads with high accuracy and sensitivity, and examines different types of alternative polyadenylation (APA) events, including those in 3’UTRs and introns, using carefully designed statistics.
